availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sallie T. Harney. Father of Selby Harney, John H. Harney, Elizabeth Harney, and Reuben Harney. Major in the Provost Guard of Louisville (U.S.A.) from March 10, 1862 to October 3, 1862. Major in the 34th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from October 3, 1862 to February 6, 1863. Lieutenant colonel in the 34th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from February 6, 1863 to June 2, 1863. Colonel in the 34th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from June 2, 1863 to December 13, 1863. Attorney in Louisville in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Two Mile House Precinct, p. 32.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 316-17.
